CHAPTER PROMPTS - Copy and paste into the positive prompt (node 3)

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
PART ONE: THE ARCHITECTS (Chapters 1-15)
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

CHAPTER 1: The Watcher
Sketch of elegant dinosaur silhouette gazing upward at dawn sky, three stones arranged in deliberate pattern at feet, peaceful clearing, side view, scientific illustration style

CHAPTER 2: The Communities  
Multiple dinosaur figures across a landscape, each engaged in different precise behaviors, stone patterns, cliff carvings, distant mountains, birds-eye view diagram, connecting lines between locations

CHAPTER 3: The Gathering
Hundreds of dinosaur silhouettes arranged in geometric pattern, all facing same direction, three-day vigil, mesa gathering place, minimal detail, pattern emphasis

CHAPTER 4: The New Star
Dinosaur frozen in stillness looking at night sky, new point of light visible, mathematical calculation symbols floating around head, thought bubble style, contemplative pose

CHAPTER 5: The Patterns Emerge
Close-up of dinosaur claws arranging complex stone pattern, massive timeline spreading across ground, another figure in background bringing food, work-in-progress diagram

CHAPTER 6: The Protectors
Dinosaur observing small mammal using stick tool, protective stance, nest visible, two-day stillness indicated by moon phases, patient watching, scientific observation style

CHAPTER 7: The Mathematics [CRITICAL]
Dinosaur standing over fallen companion, three stones moved, work continues around the body, stark composition, grief through action, no sentimentality, archaeological site feeling

CHAPTER 8: The Acceleration  
Asteroid visible as small disk in sky, dinosaur in month-long stillness, time-lapse indication, multiple mammal generations, urgency building, calendar marks

CHAPTER 9: The Encoding
Aerial view of complete stone timeline with distinct clusters, dinosaur moving between clusters and mammal populations, DNA helix patterns on cliff face, mapping diagram

CHAPTER 10: The Architects [THE REVEAL]
Three stones arranged in memorial pattern, dinosaur at completed timeline, small mammal with stick in foreground, asteroid filling quarter of sky, moment of completion

CHAPTER 11: The Completion
Multiple dinosaurs guiding specific mammals to survival territories, each carrying different encoded segments, beautiful calculated precision, distribution map style

CHAPTER 12: The Witness
Young dinosaur watching elder work, crude stone imitation nearby, knowledge being passed, no spoken words, learning through observation, generational connection

CHAPTER 13: The Silence  
Asteroid dominating sky, dinosaurs in strange peace, visiting between territories, mathematical probability floating in thought bubble: 99.7%, quiet acceptance

CHAPTER 14: The Last Gathering
Dinosaur families together at gathering points, two pressed close for warmth, young dinosaur with elder, mammals safely elsewhere, final hours, constellation pattern overhead

CHAPTER 15: The Impact
Dinosaur checking calculations one final time as light approaches, satisfaction not fear, equation balanced, poetic but not graphic, mathematical symbols and light

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
PART TWO: THE INHERITORS (Chapters 16-32)
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

CHAPTER 16: The Sequence
Woman at computer screen showing DNA sequence at 2 AM, too-regular patterns, fibonacci spirals, phone notification ignored, coffee cup, exhaustion visible, discovery moment

CHAPTER 17: The Correlation
Computer screen showing timeline: tool use, fire, agriculture clusters, activation markers highlighted, woman's hand trembling on mouse, correlation graphs, phone in other hand

CHAPTER 18: The Historian
Two people over ancient timeline map, overlaying genetic data with historical discoveries, Newton and Leibniz simultaneous breakthrough notation, connection lines being drawn

CHAPTER 19: The Genius
Mathematician staring at her own genome sequence, Fields Medal on desk, breakthrough moment deconstructed, "it just came to me" caption, identity questioning, mirror reflection

CHAPTER 20: The Network
Basement lab meeting, dozen researchers, screens showing full genetic code progression, one man answering with exact numbers, whispered concern, secret gathering atmosphere

CHAPTER 21: The Simulation  
Computer simulation showing planetary defense grid, asteroid trajectory, 65-million-year protection plan revealed, people realizing "we're tools," existential horror in body language

CHAPTER 22: The Activation
Woman surrounded by intrusive blueprint visions, satellite networks floating in thought bubbles, can't sleep, Maya's photo pushed aside, compulsion overwhelming, loss of control

CHAPTER 23: The Compulsion
Child crying at lab door while mother works, unable to stop, screens and equations everywhere, man at 4 AM construction site, partner leaving, relationships fracturing, desperate isolation

CHAPTER 24: The Choice
Small distant asteroid diagram, 40-year impact projection, woman on phone leaving voicemail, cutting off mid-sentence, returning to work, split between love and compulsion

CHAPTER 25: The Broadcast
Woman at broadcast setup, "We are not the authors" text visible, global reactions on multiple screens, construction continuing regardless, message notification on phone, truth spreading

CHAPTER 26: The Resistance
Activated woman fighting compulsion, physically ill, shaking hands, two-week calendar marked off, breaking point moment, "I tried" thought bubble, inevitable return

CHAPTER 27: The Builder [CRITICAL]
Man working while screaming, construction accident scene, loss and compulsion simultaneous, stone pattern dream symbols, wedding ring, unable to stop building, parallel to ancient grief

CHAPTER 28: The Philosopher
Two people at remote site, working in silence, brief exchange in speech bubbles, capability vs personality debate, high altitude construction, mutual understanding, quiet recognition

CHAPTER 29: The Line [THE LOVE SCENE - CRITICAL]
Calibration screen showing "COMPLETE", two people on floor, cold concrete, confused tangle of need and exhaustion, no romanticism, raw humanity, dawn window light, return to work

CHAPTER 30: The Completion
Planetary defense grid complete diagram, asteroid successfully deflected, two people brief reunion, strained mother-daughter relationship, 20-year markers, Maya with children, no resolution

CHAPTER 31: The Message [CRITICAL]
Genetic code revealing compressed memories, woman reading alone at night, ancient message decoded, "that wondering might be the only real thing" text, quiet contemplation

CHAPTER 32: The Question
Elderly woman (78) in interview, reflection over 40 years, granddaughter questioning, photo of remarried man, space travel activation beginning, "both were real" realization, wisdom without answers

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
EPILOGUE: THE CYCLE (Chapter 33)
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

CHAPTER 33: The Cycle
Alien avian scientist on different planet, asteroid in sky, encoding small mammals, mate bringing food, one-day pause after loss, return to calculation, "The mathematics was complete" eternal cycle

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
USAGE NOTES:
- These are SKETCH prompts - add the base style from node 3
- Each creates a simple, clean illustration that hints without spoiling
- Part 1 (dinosaurs): No dialogue, observational, alien intelligence
- Part 2 (humans): Intimate, desperate, relationships fracturing
- Keep minimal shading, thought bubbles for internal concepts
- Black and white, scientific diagram aesthetic throughout
━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

extra.workflow_description: Sketch-style illustrations for book interior. Simple, clean line art with minimal shading. Perfect for scientific diagrams, thought bubbles, and chapter illustrations.
